definition.title: What is share and collaborate?
definition.text:
Share and collaborate in OpenPanel is how you **get the right data to the right people** without opening the door to everything.

**Unlimited members** - There’s no cap on how many people you can invite. Add your whole team, contractors, or stakeholders and manage them from a single members view.

**Flexible access** - Each member can have:

- **Organization-wide access** - full visibility across all projects, ideal for admins and core team
- **Fine-grained access** - access only to specific projects you choose, so stakeholders see only what’s relevant

**What you can share** - You’re not limited to "all or nothing" views:

- **Complete dashboards** - share an entire dashboard so others see the same layout and reports you use
- **Individual reports** - share a single report (e.g. one funnel or one retention chart) for focused updates

**How you share** - Every shared dashboard or report can be:

- **Publicly available** - anyone with the link can view it (handy for status pages, exec summaries, or embedded views)
- **Password-protected** - only people with the password can open the link, so you keep sensitive data under control

Inviting is straightforward: add members by email, assign access (org or specific projects), and optionally share dashboards or reports with public or password-protected links. Your team stays aligned on the same numbers without compromising security or clarity.

how_it_works.title: How sharing and collaboration works
how_it_works.intro: Invite members, set access, then share dashboards or reports as needed.

steps.title: Invite members
steps.description: Add team members by email from the members area. They receive an invite and can sign in to OpenPanel with the access you’ve assigned.

steps.title: Set access level
steps.description: Give each member organization-wide access (all projects) or fine-grained access to specific projects only. You can change this anytime.

steps.title: Share dashboards or reports
steps.description: From any dashboard or report, use Share to generate a link. You can share a full dashboard or a single report.

steps.title: Choose public or password-protected
steps.description: Make the link public (anyone with the link can view) or set a password so only people who have it can open the shared view.

use_cases.title: How teams use share and collaborate
use_cases.intro: From internal alignment to client-facing reports - sharing and access control fit many workflows.

items.title: Internal team alignment
items.description: Invite product, growth, and support with access to the projects they need. Share a main dashboard so everyone looks at the same KPIs in meetings.

items.title: Stakeholder and exec updates
items.description: Give execs or stakeholders limited access to specific projects and share a single report or dashboard. No need to give them the full product - just the view that matters.

items.title: Client and partner reports
items.description: Share a dashboard or report with a client or partner via link. Use a password when the data is sensitive so only authorized people can view it.

items.title: Public status or metrics pages
items.description: Share a dashboard publicly and embed or link it from your status page, docs, or marketing site so visitors see live metrics without signing in.

related_features.title: Data visualization
related_features.description: Build the dashboards and reports you’ll share - charts, breakdowns, and custom views that stay up to date when you share them.

related_features.title: Notifications
related_features.description: Keep the team in the loop with alerts when key events happen. Complements sharing by pushing updates instead of requiring people to open a link.

related_features.title: Integrations
related_features.description: Send data to Slack, Discord, or webhooks. Use integrations for real-time alerts alongside shared dashboards for deeper exploration.

faqs.title: Frequently asked questions
faqs.intro: Common questions about sharing and collaboration in OpenPanel.

items.question: Is there a limit on how many members I can invite?
items.answer: No. You can invite an unlimited number of members. Each can have organization-wide access or access only to specific projects you choose.

items.question: What’s the difference between org-wide and project-level access?
items.answer: Org-wide access lets a member see and work with all projects in the organization. Project-level access restricts them to only the projects you assign - useful for clients, partners, or teams that only need a subset of your data.

items.question: Can I share just one report instead of a whole dashboard?
items.answer: Yes. You can share a complete dashboard or a single report (e.g. one funnel or one chart). The shared link shows only what you chose to share.

items.question: Can shared links be password-protected?
items.answer: Yes. When you create a share link for a dashboard or report, you can leave it public (anyone with the link can view) or set a password so only people with the password can open it.

items.question: Can I change a member’s access after they’ve joined?
items.answer: Yes. You can update a member’s access (add or remove projects, or switch to org-wide) or remove them from the organization at any time from the members area.
